Adult_Dosing.text:
Induction
150-200 mcg/kg IV x 1
Maintenance
Intermittent
30 mcg/kg IV q20 min PRN (Start ~50 min after induction dose)
Continuous
1-2 mcg/kg/min IV (though rates may vary widely)

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Induction
1-23 months: 150 mcg/kg IVx1
2-12 years old: 100-150 mcg/kg IV x1
>12 years old: 150-200 mcg/kg IV x1
Maintenance
>2 years old: 1-2 mcg/kg min (though rates may vary widely)

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not defined, consider extended interval between dose administration and intubation if
ESRD
Pediatric: Not defined, consider extended interval between dose administration and intubation if
ESRD

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not defined, onset 1 minute faster than healthy controls
Pediatric: Not defined, onset 1 minute faster than healthy controls

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Neonates (benzyl alcohol-containing forms)
Caution if neuromuscular disease, burns, asthma, electrolyte abnormalities

Serious.text:
Hypersensitivity reaction
Anaphylaxis
/
Anaphylactoid reaction
Bronchospasm
Hypotension
Respiratory depression
Prolonged paralysis

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 22-29 minutes
Metabolism: Liver
Excretion: Urine

Comments.text:
Cisatricurium can also be used as adjunct therapy for
ARDS
. Clinical practice guidelines recommend a short course for patients with early 
sepsis-related ARDS with a PaO2/FiO2 less than 150 mmHg.
[1]
